column4: Hey all, isnt there a way from bash to see the most recent command you have typed after you put part of the command.. like i forget which IP i vncd to, but i thought you could do like vncviewer ... and press something that completed the command you last did
hows that ctrl R thing work.. i typed sudo then pressed ctrl + r dialog poped up about reverse string.. but what do i do next
usually better to hit ctrl-r first then type the string you want to search the history for.  hitting ctrl-r again cycles matching commands in history
